name: David H. Parramon
personalDescription00:
I am a Front-End Web Developer with experience in software quality assurance & engineering.
 I have developed mobile applications for Android devices, with extensive focus on augmented realty and QR codes and have working knowledge of IOS programming
personalDescription01: A Front-End Web developer and computer's nerd. All this meanwhile is rissing a family in the midwest and stays up to date with the latest front end trends.

experiences.description: Worked as Front End Dev lead for styling, with focus on accessibility, styles architecture, consultance and semantics and Javascript developement
Collaborations as Freelance. Front-end development & consultant, Layout creation, Code development, Cross-browser & mobile device compatibility assurance.

Quality Assurance test developer, creating test cases telecomunication services.
 My task was infrastructures valoration, individual test creation, documentation, creation of walkthrough for future references.
Full Stack Developer Server development and creation of a test-environment.
Quality Assurance Engineer at Roche Diagnostics Validation and testing in a low-error tolerance systems, documentation and error-reporting
Front-End Web Developer, semantic, cross-browser front-end code, Layout creation and code development, Web maintenance (including VIP web and an important home page)

projects.name: Android QR app
projects.client: UPC - Universitat Politecnica de Catalunya (Catalonia Polytechnics University)
projects.description:
Android app, created with the objective to make an extensive use of QR codes, databases and Android devices capabilities.
 Scanning a QR code by the side of a determinate classroom in the university, the phone is able to tell, what class is being told at that moment, what teacher is in it, and what comes next.

projects.name: Stop Neonicotonoids Animation
projects.description:
Animation created, designed and developed for a general audience to show the effects of Neonicotinoids (a new kind of pesticide) in the environment.
 Software used: Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Afterefects.

projects.name: NAT (Nerdery Assessment test)
projects.description:
Web project with extensive use of standards, reusability, code and browser compatibility (IE8+, Firefox latest release, Chrome latest release and Safari latest release).
 This will be a much larger site than a single page, and the code was written to be flexible and reusable throughout the site.
 I did my best to create a Javascript/Jquery code that is as scalable, flexible, maintainable, semantic and accessible as possible.

projects.name: Capella web project
projects.description:
In this project I had to create an interactive web App, using Javascript/Jquery/JqueryUI, that allows to sort a list (a number not determined) of Items in another part of the screen and check if that Items are correct.
 It had to be easy to add/change/delete items for someone that doesn't have extensive knowledge of Javascript.

projects.name: Chefella
projects.description: Collaborations as Freelance. Front-end development & consultant, Layout creation, Code development, Cross-browser & mobile device compatibility assurance.

projects.name: Barcelona Home web Project
projects.description: I had to build part of the landing page of Barcelona City according to a design provided (Nowadays the actual landing page has change with a new design)

projects.name: NWHSU project
projects.description: This was a rather diferent project, the objective: Create a animation to help students understand how 2 vertebreas moves and how it looks when there is a dislocation on them
